name: Excessive Expenses v1.3
description: Idea is to take control of the Corp ICE and funds so you could just walk in and take what you want. Reworked... Thanks for the advice!

name: Justin new central deck
description: Dominate Centrals, exposes remote using Silhouette's Ability, 'Quest complete' it for the score.

name: Kate Deck Linky
Baiting with Wayland v1.0
description: I am trying to bait the runner into running at a cost and then punishing if they do score. Idea is to have at most 2 remote servers.

name: No Rez
description:
This deck, like most Reina decks, is meant to capitalize on the corp rezzing ICE. It means to do that with two main methods:

--Increasing rez cost: Reina ability, Xanadu, Rook, (Total +4) --Fostering credit swings when ICE is rezzed: Compromised Employee, Ice Analyzer (+1 for anything, +1 for programs which makes up almost half of the deck)

The honorable mention here is the Ice Carver/Bishop/Datasucker trio to make the rezzed ice a bit more porous.

Once you get to late game some of the tools will become obsolete. At that time you should have a full breaker suite and can trash those dead cards to Aesops for extra running creds.

name: Noise got new Toys
description: A versatile and difficult deck that can be really annoying.

name: Noise "V" (GoodGames Melbourne Store Championship winner)
description:
The trick to this deck? There are no tricks.

Economy:

1/3 of the cards are economy. It makes life easy knowing that I will always draw into economy.

Viruses:

Just the absolute essentials. I am not relying on milling at all. But you can't deny that it is hugely disruptive and since corps now RELY on Jackson, it's so strong to force them to trash it early.

Breakers:

Crypsis and Corroder are all you need. :)

No Djinn:

Why? Too slow. No surprise factor. I have never ever been happy when I have had to spend a credit and click to use Djinn in my entire Netrunner career. I decided not to include this card that was holding me back.

No Sahasrara and no Workshop:

Bread and butter economy allows me to play far more aggressively.

No Plascrete:

Who cares? It's not the mindset I want to be playing with. Caution loses games.

Play style:

I play what I am dealt and don't have a set plan. This deck can win with any combination of cards, which is why it is so robust. There is not a single card in this deck that I MUST draw every game in order to be competitive.

There are so many different attack vectors in this deck. It's not easy to protect archives, R&D, HQ AND a remote. The way the corp is forced to protect their servers means that almost without fail, they will have an HQ loaded with agendas towards the end. Do they keep them and risk the HQ run or do they throw them back into R&D and risk the Medium dig?

Luck:

My surgical virus mills get called "lucky" all the time. But is it really luck or is it playing the probabilities well?...

Okay, it's luck.

name: NBN "Morag" (GoodGames Melbourne Store Championship winner)
description:
MVPs are definitely:

  1. Eli - the best counter to Corroder.
  2. Viper - the best counter to... any code gate breaking solution.
  3. Celebrity Gift - Going from 3 credits to 10 credits in two clicks is a huge advantage for getting into the NBN sweet spot of 8 credits.

15 Ice? Sometimes you just have to bluff not having any agendas in HQ. High risk, high reward. If the game goes on too long then you've lost anyway.

name: Silly economy is silly V2.0
description:
I changed the economy and ice a bit. I removed both the * level clearance and added beanstalk and GRNDL refineries. I also changed the ice a little bit. I removed both Archers, one Curtain Wall and one Hadrian's Wall and added a couple of Tollbooths and 3 Rototurrets.

To be honest the economy now is not that excessive but it still is formidable enough. If you manage to hide a refinery and a Simone behind an Off the Grid for a couple of turns, things can get ugly very fast. ;)

name: Weyland GRNDL - Image Control
description:
This is my first deck, so be gentle :) Basically I built it around the concept of gaining and removing bad publicity, with Off the Grids to make agendas untouchable and a couple of Aggressive Negotiations to tutor up the puzzle pieces.

Haven't playtested yet, so it quite possibly sucks, but I'd appreciate some advice on how it could be improved! I had no idea what I was doing with the ice really, I just threw in ones that fit the theme. Not sure about Executive Retreat either, but I wanted to keep agenda density down and the hand refresh seems kinda useful.

name: HackThePlanet
description: A totally new ice-destruction archetype. Draw into Blackguard + Snitch to start forcing the corp to rez their ice. Then destroy it with the mean Parasite + Datasucker combo. While you're setting up, use Crypsis + Datasucker to smash into remote servers and stop the corp from rushing out agendas. Rez and destroy, rinse and repeat.

name: This Professor Studies Virii
Whizzard_V1.2
description: Feedback appreciated!

name: Whizzard - HQ oriented
Medical Times
description: Missing 2x Fast Track (threw in 2 zaibatsu loyalty to complete the list)

name: Turn 1 Janus
description:
The basic idea here is to rez gigantic ice (Wotan, Janus, Heimdall 2.0, Archer) using Oversight and Bioroid Efficiency, then make said big ice really hard/ painful to get through with Chum, Tyr's Hand, False Lead, and Project Wotan. Also leaves the door open for some pretty insane Accelerated Beta Tests (Archer, Janus, Chum FTW).

There is an incredibly small amount of econ for this deck, but up to this point it hasn't been a problem with the credits from ETF, and how little you actually have to spend rezzing ice.

This deck is really fun to play and has some wild swings. Sometimes you get Turn 1 Janus, sometimes you mulligan and get the Archer, Janus, 3 agenda hand. Haven't taken it to a tournament yet, so I wonder if it'd be consistent enough. Either way, lemme know what you think!

name: Yellow fever V_1
description: Can this really work?

name: Kit Stim
Noise/Darwin/Guivre
Jinteki Matchpoint Run v2
description:
Target deck when HnP comes out. The object of the game is to get to match point as soon as possible. This would threaten the runner to run almost anything you install and advance. Allowing you to play the Junebugs and the Overwriters with more efficiency.

I'm thinking one doesn't need big Ice as games should be short and done before the runner can set up his rig.

What do you guys think?

Edit: Modified the Agendas to make the game really reach match point when one scores an agenda.

Changed the ice mix in order to have more versatility and keep the runner guessing.

name: MedTech
Weyland: Because We Garbage Collect
description: Eh, first pass Vegan/BreakerBeater

name: Fast weyland 123456
Combo Scavenge + Test run
HB Rush
Kate Begins 3.1
2014 Total Escape Store Championship - 1st Place Corp
description: March 16th, 2014 - Benjamin B's corp deck from the Total Escape Games' Store Championship. After three rounds of Swiss, Ben went 3-0 with this deck and finished in first place.

name: 2014 Total Escape Store Championship - 1st Place Runner
description: March 16th, 2014 - Benjamin B's runner deck from the Total Escape Games' Store Championship. After three rounds of Swiss, Ben went 3-0 with this deck and finished in first place.

name: Kate Begins 3.1
Porca Trojan! - v 1.2
description:
Very funny to play and quite solid. :)

I'm not sure if armitage is better than liberated account... but this last one has a better artwork! XD

I do love Imp and I hate Carapace. To prevent you to be scorched, use Imp to trash directly from Crop hand. Alternative: -2 Ice Carver + 2 Plascrete carapace.

name: Suied Noise - Melbourne Store Championship 2nd Place
description:
Original list from Sam Suied at http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/2806/r2p-store-championship-runner-deck-sam-suied

Some minor changes to fit the metagame, Joshua B is too much of a liability so corroder was brought in to take the pressure off Crypsis/Knight/Parasite.

name: "Glacier" Weyland - Melbourne Store Championship 2nd Place
description:
Original list from http://stimhack.com/winning-decklists-game-cafe-store-championship-2014/

Heimdall was dropped for Jackson as the deck has no shortage of big ICE and Jackson feels like a necessity in a long tournament. Melange was replaced with GRNDL refinery to give some more tactical options and overall feels like a more powerful economy piece. The remaining influence could be spent on an additional Rototurret or Jackson, whatever your preference is.
